passage:
(1) Markets are places where people buy and sell things. In a traditional market, sellers put their goods on tables or in shops. Buyers walk around and look at different items. When they find something they want, they ask the price. Sometimes, buyers can negotiate with sellers to get a lower price.

(2) There are many types of markets around the world. Some markets sell only food, like fruits, vegetables, and meat. Other markets sell clothes, toys, or electronics. Big markets often have sections for different types of products. This helps buyers find what they need more easily.

(3) To buy something, a customer first chooses the item they want. Then, they pay the seller with cash or a card. The seller gives the customer a receipt, which is a piece of paper that shows what was bought and how much it cost. If the customer pays with cash, the seller often gives them change.

(4) Today, many people also buy and sell things online. In online markets, sellers post pictures and descriptions of their products. Buyers look at these and decide what to buy. They pay with credit cards or digital payment methods. Then, the seller sends the products to the buyer's home or office. Online markets are convenient because people can shop without leaving their homes.

Choose the correct adverb: 'He speaks English ___.'
Which sentence has the correct word order?

options.A: Always she goes to bed at 10 PM.
options.B: She goes always to bed at 10 PM.
options.C: She always goes to bed at 10 PM.
options.D: She goes to bed always at 10 PM.

What is a 'bill'?

questions.question: According to paragraph 1, what can buyers sometimes do when they find something they want?

options.A: They can take it for free
options.B: They can negotiate with sellers for a lower price
options.C: They can sell it to someone else
options.D: They can exchange it for another item

questions.question: Based on paragraph 2, why do big markets have different sections?

options.A: To make the market look nicer
options.B: To separate expensive and cheap products
options.C: To help buyers find what they need more easily
options.D: To keep sellers from competing with each other

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what is a receipt?

options.A: Money given back to the customer
options.B: A piece of paper showing what was bought and the cost

questions.question: What happens after a buyer pays in an online market?

options.A: The buyer goes to pick up the product
options.B: The seller sends the products to the buyer's home or office
options.C: The buyer meets the seller in person
options.D: The seller delivers the product immediately

questions.question: According to the passage, what is one advantage of online markets?

options.C: People can shop without leaving their homes
options.D: Sellers don't need to provide receipts

questions.question: What do buyers do in a traditional market before asking the price?

options.A: They pay with cash or card
options.B: They walk around and look at different items

questions.question: Based on the passage, what might a food market sell?
What do sellers in online markets provide to help buyers decide what to buy?

options.C: Pictures and descriptions of their products

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what might a seller give if a customer pays with cash?
What is the main topic of this passage?

options.C: How markets work for buying and selling
